comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Uppermost caption on plate appears to read "Wedding of Archduke Karl Franz Josef + Princess Zita" Karl Franz Josef was the grandnephew of Emperor Franz Josef, and became heir presumptive to the throne upon the assasination of his uncle Franz Ferdinand on 28 June, 1914. He later became Karl I, Emperor of Austria upon the death of Emperior Franz Josef See: books.google.com.au/books?id=zeN37uwbr3YC&pg=PA163&am... The bride would be Princess Zita of Bourbon-Parma. www.firstworldwar.com/bio/karl.htm They married on 21 October 1911. Here's another wedding pic with his parents Maria Josefa and Emporer Franz Joseph (all wearing same regalia as this LOC/Bain picture, although men appear hatless : worldroots.com/brigitte/gifs/zita+karl.jpg Bonus- Here is a some great photolinks for the clan: worldroots.com/brigitte/royal/karlaustria1887album.htm

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: yes, the gentleman/photo should be titled Emporer Franz Joseph
